# Arpeggio: Minor 7th in C# (Shape: D)

An arpeggio is a musical technique where the notes of a chord are played or sung in a sequence, one note at a time. The Minor 7th arpeggio in C# (also known as Db) in the shape of D consists of the notes D-F#-A-C#. This arpeggio is commonly used in various styles of music to create a sense of tension and release, adding color and texture to musical passages.

## Notes and Intervals
- D (Root)
- F# (Minor 3rd)
- A (Perfect 5th)
- C# (Minor 7th)

## Musical Flavor and Genre
The Minor 7th arpeggio in C# adds a jazzy and soulful flavor to music. It is often used in jazz, blues, R&B, funk, and fusion genres to create a sophisticated and emotive sound. The Minor 7th chord itself has a smooth and mellow quality, and when played as an arpeggio, it can evoke a sense of melancholy or introspection.

## Songs
Here are three songs that feature the Minor 7th arpeggio in C#:
1. **"All Blues" by Miles Davis**: This jazz standard prominently features Minor 7th arpeggios in various keys, including C#. The arpeggios add depth and color to the improvisational sections of the song.
2. **"Superstition" by Stevie Wonder**: The iconic guitar riff in this funk classic uses Minor 7th arpeggios, including the C# Minor 7th arpeggio in the shape of D, to create a groovy and soulful vibe.
3. **"I Can't Make You Love Me" by Bonnie Raitt**: This emotional ballad uses the Minor 7th arpeggio, including the C# Minor 7th arpeggio, to enhance the heartfelt and poignant atmosphere of the song.
